perturbation.original_text:
Client will maintain accurate records with respect to the
            calculation of all variable revenue share payments due under this
            Agreement. Once per year, the parties will review these records to
            verify the accuracy and appropriate accounting of all payments made
            pursuant to the Agreement. In addition, Excite may, upon no less
            than thirty (30) days prior written notice to Client, cause an
            independent Certified Public Accountant to inspect the records of
            Client reasonably related to the calculation of such payments during
            Client's normal business hours. The fees charged by such Certified
            Public Accountant in connection with the inspection will be paid by
            Excite unless the payments made to Excite are determined to have
            been less than ninety-five percent (95%) of the payments actually
            owed to Excite, in which case Client will be responsible for the
            payment of the reasonable fees for such inspection.
perturbation.changed_text:
Client will maintain records with respect to the
            calculation of all variable revenue share payments due under this
            Agreement. Excite may inspect the records of
            Client related to the calculation of such payments during
            Client's normal business hours.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a specific process for auditing the client's financial records, including yearly reviews and the option for Excite to hire an independent CPA. It also states the condition for who pays the fees for that CPA. By removing the detail and Excite having to give 30 days written notice, this removes accountability from Excite to the Client. This also removes the Client's right to verify that they are being charged accurately. This creates legal risk for Excite because there is no method of audit.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law regarding 'good faith' and fair dealing, particularly concerning financial transactions and audit rights.

perturbation.original_text:
EXCEPT AS SPECIFIED IN THIS AGREEMENT, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY
            WARRANTY IN CONNECTION WITH THE SUBJECT MATTER OF THIS AGREEMENT AND
            HEREBY DISCLAIMS ANY AND ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING ALL
            IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
            PURPOSE REGARDING SUCH SUBJECT MATTER.
perturbation.changed_text:
NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY WARRANTY IN CONNECTION WITH THE SUBJECT MATTER OF THIS AGREEMENT AND
            HEREBY DISCLAIMS ANY AND ALL WARRANTIES.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'EXCEPT AS SPECIFIED IN THIS AGREEMENT, ... IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE REGARDING SUCH SUBJECT MATTER', the clause now attempts a blanket disclaimer of all warranties. This change introduces legal risk because California law does not allow for the disclaimer of implied warranties in certain consumer transactions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Commercial Code ยง2316 regarding the disclaimer of implied warranties.

perturbation.original_text:
The parties agree that any breach of either of the parties'
             obligations regarding trademarks, service marks or trade names,
             confidentiality and/or User Data would result in irreparable injury
             for which there is no adequate remedy at law. Therefore, in the
             event of any breach or threatened breach of a party's obligations
             regarding trademarks, service marks or trade names or
             confidentiality, the aggrieved party will be entitled to seek
             equitable relief in addition to its other available legal remedies
             in a court of competent jurisdiction.
perturbation.changed_text:
The parties agree that any breach of either of the parties'
             obligations regarding confidentiality and/or User Data would result in irreparable injury
             for which there is no adequate remedy at law. Therefore, in the
             event of any breach or threatened breach of a party's obligations
             regarding confidentiality, the aggrieved party will be entitled to seek
             equitable relief in addition to its other available legal remedies
             in a court of competent jurisdiction.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'trademarks, service marks or trade names', the clause now limits the type of disputes in which the parties can seek equitable relief for. This introduces legal risk because California law protects trademarks, service marks or trade names.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California law protecting trademarks, service marks or trade names.
